titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Heman Lincoln Papers
titlestmt.author: Staff of Andover Newton Theological School Library and Yale Divinity Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday March 28, 2019 at 22:02

did.abstract: The Heman Lincoln Papers primarily document the professional work of Lincoln as a Baptist minister and professor at Newton Theological Institution.

chronitem.event: Minister, New Britain Baptist Church, PA
Minister, Franklin Square Baptist Church, Philadelphia, PA
Minister, First Baptist Church, Jamaica Plain, MA
Minister, Central Baptist Church, Providence, RI
Professor, Church History, Newton Theological Institution
Professor, Homiletics, Pastoral Duties and Church Polity, Newton Theological Institution

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Heman Lincoln Papers, 1838-1887, primarily document the professional work of Lincoln. The collection is arranged according to the following categories: diaries, letters, lectures and essays, sermons, student lecture notes, and notes on readings, miscellaneous papers. The miscellaneous material includes data related to Lincoln's pastorates and scrapbooks of clippings related to Baptist churches in general. The bulk of the collection consists of sermons, including 215 undated sermons and dated sermons from 1838-1880.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: From the Andover Newton Theological School collection, transferred in 2017

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Heman Lincoln Papers (RG 290), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in seven series: I. Diaries.

did.unittitle: Lists of readings, some diary entries

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes letters and writings of Peter Johnson, Robert, Orramel, Francis H. T., Francis A. S., Annie, and Emily Gulick
